block.p: Elain Nancy Calmon and Barry Gene Waldman are to be married this evening by Rabbi Marcelo Bronstein at Water's Edge, a restaurant in Long Island City, Queens.
The bride, 32, is a marketing director at NBC Universal, in Manhattan. She graduated from the University of North Carolina.
Elain Nancy Calmon and Barry Gene Waldman are to be married this evening by Rabbi Marcelo Bronstein at Waterâ€™s Edge, a restaurant in Long Island City, Queens.
Elain Nancy Calmon and Barry Gene Waldman are to be married this evening by Rabbi Marcelo Bronstein at Water's Edge, a restaurant in Long Island City, Queens.
The bride, 32, is a marketing director at NBC Universal, in Manhattan. She graduated from the University of North Carolina.

She is a daughter of Claudia and Leslie Calmon of Clearwater, Fla. Her parents work in Clearwater, where her father is a wood-veneer consultant for furniture manufacturers and veneer dealers, and her mother makes jewelry.

The bridegroom, 36, is a vice president for direct and interactive marketing strategy at a division of McCann Worldgroup, an advertising and communications unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies in Manhattan.

He is a son of Harriet and Benjamin Waldman of Livingston, N.J. His mother, who is retired, taught French at James Caldwell High School in West Caldwell, N.J. His father, also retired, was a mechanical engineer at Picatinny Arsenal, an Army weapons research and development center in New Jersey.
